Package io.hacksy.util.fluent

Class FluentTry<T>

java.lang.Object
io.hacksy.util.fluent.FluentTry<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type parameter
public class FluentTry<T> extends Object
A utility class for representing try/catch logic to handle both checked and unchecked exceptions in fluent or functional workflows or anywhere a try/catch is inconvenient.

  • Method Details

    • get

      public T get() throws CaughtException
      Return the result of the supplier provided on construction, including null. If the supplier threw an exception on execution, it will be wrapped in CaughtException and thrown.

      Example: 
      
 FluentTry<String> try = FluentTry.of(() -> "myString");
 try.get(); // "myString"
      Returns:
      the result of the supplier, including null
      Throws:
      CaughtException - the wrapped exception if thrown by the supplier

    • onError

      public FluentTry<T> onError(Consumer<Throwable> throwableConsumer)
      An entry point to perform a side effect on the caught exception. The consumer is only executed if the supplier threw on execution.

      Example: 
      
 FluentTry<String> try = FluentTry.of(() -> volatileFunction());
 try.onError(err -> log.error(err.getMessage());
      Parameters:
      throwableConsumer - consumer to perform a side effect on a caught error
      Returns:
      the unchanged FluentTry

    • mapError

      public FluentTry<T> mapError(UnaryOperator<Throwable> throwableMapper)
      An entry point to map from one error to another. Only executed if the supplier threw on exception.

      Example: 
      
 FluentTry<String> try = FluentTry.of(() -> volatileFunction());
 try.mapError(err -> new RuntimeException(err));
      Parameters:
      throwableMapper - the error mapping function
      Returns:
      the FluentTry with the mapped error if error was present

    • mapErrorToResult

      public FluentTry<T> mapErrorToResult(Function<Throwable,T> throwableMapper)
      An entry point to provide a function to map a thrown error to a fallback value of Type. Only use this method if the fallback value makes uses of the thrown exception. Otherwise, use ToOptional with OrElse.

      Example: 
      
 FluentTry<String> try = FluentTry.of(() -> volatileFunction());
 try.mapErrorToResult(err -> "fallback"));
      Parameters:
      throwableMapper - the error mapping function
      Returns:
      the FluentTry with the fallback value if error was present

    • toOptional

      public Optional<T> toOptional()
      Return an optional based on the outcome of the supplied provided on construction. Null values or thrown exceptions return an empty Optional. Otherwise and Optional of the supplied value is returned.

      Example: 
      
 FluentTry<String> try = FluentTry.of(() -> "myString");
 try.toOptional(); // Optional.of("myString")
      Returns:
      Optional of empty or the supplied value

    • toOptionalError

      public Optional<Throwable> toOptionalError()
      Return an optional based on the outcome of the supplied provided on construction. Anything other than an exception returns an empty Optional. Otherwise, an Optional of the thrown error is returned.

      Example: 
      
 FluentTry<String> try = FluentTry.of(() -> volatileFunction());
 try.toOptionalError(); // Optional.of(SomeException)
      Returns:
      an optional of the thrown error
